content.description: Climb flake/crack to shallow corner, up & left through pocketed face, finish up & right to ring anchor
content.location: 60' left of Jacob's Ladder there is a large tree leaning against the wall. 15' left of this tree is "one fingered pic-pocket" "Skin the thief" is the route to the left.

climbs.name: Oyster Cracker
climbs.fa: Mike Artz, Andrew Barry and Bruce Burgin 10/85

content.description: Right leaning orange colored flake. Cool moves and good gear up the flake to a small ledge just above two small roofs. Finishes up and to the right.
content.protection: Standard rack, mostly small to medium pro.  Bolted anchor.
content.location: This climb is located far to the right of The Undeserved. Just down and left of the old Central Endless rap. Obvious right leaning, orange colored flake.

content.description: Like its neighbor, Kline the Billy Goat, this route is all about slabaneering in the depths of the Endless hinterlands. Once again, put yer dancing shoes on and get ready to bust a jig, or do the funky chicken up the wall. Unlike its neighbor, you better be ready to bust out your go-go-gadget arms to reach a few holds. Also unlike its neighbor, there is a true crux. Be ready to use a thin crimp and high step to make your way to the anchor.
content.location: Just right of Kline the Billy Goat.

content.description: Start off block left of leaning tree. Climb up face past a one finger pocket crux.
content.protection: 6 bolts to shared anchors of Skin the Thief.

content.description: Put yer' dancing shoes on Darlene and get ready to cut a rug up this slab climb. Edges and pockets will allow passage to the top. Don't be afraid to do a bit of wandering. No discernible crux other than keeping your wits about you.
content.protection: 5 bolts and a few small cams. Bolted anchors. Essentially a sport climb with some big fall potential. Be careful heading to the second bolt and to the last bolt.  Bolted anchor.
content.location: This route is on the low angle face right of the classic Oyster Cracker. It is the middle route, just right of Man-O-War and just left of The New Reed Route.

content.description: Very intricate, diverse climbing.  Start just to the right of the sport route Manilla Vanure, making some big moves up to a jug rail and a fixed piton (can be backed up with a ballnut).  More really cool big moves lead past one more pin, then a rusty bolt and the crux: a devious crimp sequence to the right of the bolt.  Steep hero jugs lead up left to the anchors of Manilla Vanure.
content.protection: Two pins, one bolt, and lots of small gear.  Bolted anchor.

content.description: Bubbas starts just left of the layback corner, Oyster Cracker. Although short, this beautiful burnt orange face packs a punch. From the minute you leave the ground be ready to get your "argh!" on. Crimping, scrunchy high steps, and few dead points will get you through the difficulties. It might not be the Arapilies but Endless Wall is every bit as good.
